description: This unit prepares the aspiring school leader to facilitate substantive and sustainable change in a school in which they lead learning communities to improve the core work of teaching and learning. It addresses three themes. First, it examines the need to develop relationships with others in order to establish communities. It highlights the place of collaboration and interdependence in leading learning communities, within and beyond the school. Second, it examines theories of strategic change and the contexts for fostering learning and effecting change. Third, it explores critical areas of concern for school improvement and performance and the tensions around securing accountability and performance development.
